isis.stitle: FRONT NON-DRIVE STEERING AXLE: ROCKWELL - INSPECTION

svcproc.title: GENERAL
svcproc.para: Do the following during an inspection.

step1.para: Make sure all fasteners are tightened to the specified torque. Use a torque wrench to check the torque in a tightening direction. As soon as the fastener starts to move, record the torque. Correct if necessary. Replace any worn or damaged fasteners.

note.para: The repair or reconditioning of front axle components is not allowed. Rockwell recommends replacing damaged or out-of-specification components. All major components are heat treated and tempered.

warning.para: The components cannot be bent, welded, heated or repaired in any way without reducing the strength or life of the component, voiding the warranty, and possibly causing a vehicle accident which can result in serious personal injury.

step1.para: Inspect the parts of the axle for wear and damage. Look for bent or cracked parts. Replace all worn or damaged parts.
Make sure looseness does not exist at the pivot points. Make sure the pivot points are lubricated.
Make sure all the parts move freely through the complete turning radius.
Inspect the tires for wear patterns that indicate suspension damage or misalignment.
